> 
> Max can you please actually release a statement and some information instead of just making disparate comments on twitter and reddit. You have a platform that allows you to put information in one place, try it out.
> As Maxmaps said on [Reddit](http://www.reddit.com/r/KerbalSpaceProgram/comments/3a4ax0/were_broadening_the_ksp_universe_by_bringing_it/cs95m20) they are actually working with some studio called Flying Tiger and they will handle the port. Flying Tiger is best known for terrible Mobile games, so thats fun.
> 
> I guess that is better than having the KSP team trying to do both. I still think its a terrible idea and it seems to be completely off the rails over there at this point. There's no direction.

Uh, why did they hook up with a company that is known to be bad at making mobile games?

At least they'll get the blame if it does down the drain.

> 
> Where did he say that? Would have been great if he said that in the forum post honestly.

Actually, he did.

> 
> No dev time lost thanks to the kind people at Flying Tiger, who have shown us fantastic progress with getting the game working on the PS4. Also they've been great to work with as well, as Unity 5 was something both studios could work on at the same time and it really, really increased the speed at which we progressed through that project.
> Worry not, 1.0.3 is still being worked on and you shouldn't have to wait much longer for it.
> 
> Edit: And you'd be amazed at how well the DS4 works with the game. We certainly were ourselves.
And why the heck doesn't he actually post the stuff on the forum or the OP of this thread even!?!?!?!?!?! /rantity-rantity-rant

Is... is this the same Flying Tiger that's developing the port?

Oh, I missed that in the fast moving posts.

> 
> Guys, think about it this way. Sure, everyone here is a PC-gamer and plays KSP on the PC and doesn't care about other consoles. But what about the people who can't afford the time and money to set up a PC, or already have a console, and thought that KSP was a really cool idea that they could not play? They wouldn't be a part of this forum of course, because they can't play it. But when they load up their gaming news website and an article mentions that rocket sim they liked the idea of being ported to a PlayStation4, and assuming they have a PlayStation4, their eyes are gonna light up, because they get to play Kerbal Effing Space Program!
> And of course, as has been stated several times, the console dev team will not take away at all from Squad's work on the PC core game, and in fact has boosted the development of Unity 5 upgrade.

Yeah, this thing.
Squad...you've lost your mind. Consoles are usually known for having reliable and stable games. Fix the lots and lots of bugs and polish the game first.

> 
> Squad...you've lost your mind. Consoles are usually known for having reliable and stable games.

That was like a century ago, today you'll get a 20GB patch and still can't play the utterly broken multiplayer.^^'

Stock KSP has been perfectly for me. Only issue is ofc the 1.0.2 heat gauge memory crash, but that one was very easily isolated.

> 
> Squad...you've lost your mind. Consoles are usually known for having reliable and stable games. Fix the lots and lots of bugs and polish the game first.

lol thanks ximrm I needed a laugh.

This explains the sudden "OMG BETA" and "HEY LOOK WE'RE DONE IT'S A COMPLETE GAME NOW" releases.

Can't say I'm pleased.

At all.

Next will be EA sellout Devnotes?

Yeah, introduce the new constantly crashing experience with pre-last-gen graphics to the ps4. If KSP were a finished game, then I'd have absolutely no problem with it. 1.0 means nothing and that game heavily relies on mods.

Edit: I take it back. Go Squad! Go! I'm really curious what's going to happen.

I was expecting something of the lines of "1.0.3 will finally be production-ready despite changing a major version of the engine". Oh well, that still may stand, given that they still are focusing on the PC. I truly wish them best of luck with Flying Tiger, because they'll need it. Tons upon tons of the bestest of lucks.
